list.name: The first man and woman were Adam and Eve.
list.definition: Who were the first man and woman?

list.name: Adam and Eve were innocent and holy when they came from the hand of God.
list.definition: Were Adam and Eve innocent and holy when they came from the hand of God?

list.name: To try their obedience God commanded Adam and Eve not to eat of a certain fruit which grew in the garden of Paradise.
list.definition: Did God give any command to Adam and Eve?

list.name: The chief blessings intended for Adam and Eve, had they remained faithful to God, were a constant state of happiness in this life and everlasting glory in the next.
list.definition: Which were the chief blessings intended for Adam and Eve had they remained faithful to God?

list.name: Adam and Eve did not remain faithful to God; but broke His command by eating the forbidden fruit.
list.definition: Did Adam and Eve remain faithful to God?

list.name: Adam and Eve, on account of their sin, lost innocence and holiness, and were doomed to sickness and death.
list.definition: What befell Adam and Eve on account of their sin?

list.name: On account of the disobedience of our first parents we all share in their sin and punishment, as we should have shared in their happiness if they had remained faithful.
list.definition: What has happened to us on account of the disobedience of our first parents?

list.name: Our nature was corrupted by the sin of our first parents, which darkened our understanding, weakened our will, and left us a strong inclination to evil.
list.definition: What other effects followed from the sin of our first parents?

list.name: The sin which we inherit from our first parents is called original sin.
list.definition: What is the sin called which we inherit from our first parents?

list.name: This sin is called original because it comes down to us from our first parents, and we are brought into the world with its guilt on our souls.
list.definition: Why is this sin called original?

list.name: This corruption of our nature and other punishments remain in us after original sin is forgiven.
list.definition: Does this corruption of our nature remain in us after original sin is forgiven?

list.name: The Blessed Virgin Mary, through the merits of her Divine Son, was preserved free from the guilt of original sin, and this privilege is called her Immaculate Conception.
list.definition: Was any one ever preserved from original sin?
